alert.note: Alert for Essex; Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:43PM EST until December 21 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts...New Hampshire... Merrimack River AT Lawrence affecting Essex County. Merrimack River At Lowell affecting Middlesex and Essex Counties. Spicket River Near Methuen affecting Rockingham and Essex Counties. For the Merrimack River...including Lowell, Lawrence...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Spicket River...including Methuen...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merrimack River at Lowell. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 52.0 feet, Lowland flooding is likely along the Merrimack River. Most of the impact will be felt by businesses and mills where basement flooding is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:31 PM EST Monday the stage was 49.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 52.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 53.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 52.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 53.1 feet on 04/18/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at noon EST.
